'''Martek''' was a wizard known as the Grand Vizier of [[Raurin]]. He was legendary in his power, and particularly known for his prophecy that the [[Efreeti|efreet]] [[Khalitharius]] would break free of his binding. In {{yearlink|1356}}, he was resurrected by adventurers at the end of a long, convoluted quest he had designed a thousand years prior.{{cite book/Desert of Desolation|4}}

History.Rulership: Before the [[River Athis]] dried, Martek ruled over lands downstream of [[Medinat Muskawoon]]. He also had a citadel, to which people could be transported by any [[Pillar of Martek]]. Inside his citadel, Martek hosted several courses to test whether uninvited guests were at least worth his time. Three such tests had been completed successfully in his life.
History.Binding of Khalitharius:
Martek began preparing for the end of Pasha Khalitharius' imprisonment at least 50 years before the latter even arrived in [[Raurin]], somewhere around the year {{yearlink|300}}. Before the River Athis dried, Martek had gave the [[Star of Mo-Pelar]] to the pharaoh [[Amun-Re]].{{cite book/Desert of Desolation|5}} The star-gem was named by the pharaoh as a key component of the curse that dried the river.{{cite book/Desert of Desolation|30}} He also gave the [[Star of Shah-Pelar]] to another pharaoh of the desert; it was stolen at some point afterwards by [[Badr Al-Mosak]], who had it displayed in his [[Crypt of Badr Al-Mosak|crypt]].

Over 1000 years before {{yearlink|1356}}{{cite book/Desert of Desolation|94}} After an extended battle, Martek emerged victorious, having bound the [[efreet]] into a lead box, though their battle unleashed energies that set the desert for tens of miles around on fire for a score years, creating the [[Skysea]].{{cite book/Desert of Desolation|95}}
History.Resurrection: In the year of {{yearlink|1356}}, a scholar of Martek's prophecies, [[Aman Al-Raqib]], sent some adventurers in a quest for Martek's Sphere of Power, anticipating it would be needed in order to defeat the efreet.{{cite book/Desert of Desolation|11}} These adventurers released the Pasha just as planned,{{cite book/Desert of Desolation|36}}

document_data.Trivia: Martek was the author of ''[[Martek, By Martek]]''. He also owned two posters of note, one labeled "Martek for Shah", and one labeled "Visit Beautiful [[Cormyr]]".{{cite book/Desert of Desolation|127}}
